alert.note: Alert for Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 3:21AM CST until February 24 at 12:37PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Franklin TN, Lincoln and Moore. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 319 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up 0.5 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winchester, Fayetteville, Lynchburg, Decherd, Estill Springs, Petersburg, Tims Ford Lake, Sewanee, Lois, Mulberry, Marble Hill, Hurdlow, Booneville, Smithland, Kelso, Mimosa, Lexie Crossroads, Harmony, Belleville and Molino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
